TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RunState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: The RunState enum indicates whether a test can be executed. When used on a TestResult it may also indicate whether the test has been executed. See individual values for restrictions on use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.iOS.dll=NUnit.Framework.Api.RunState Explicit = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The test can only be run explicitly. Would normally not appear on a TestResult, since it would change to Executed or Skipped.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.iOS.dll=NUnit.Framework.Api.RunState Ignored = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The test has been ignored. May appear on a Test, when the IgnoreAttribute is used. Appears on a TestResult in that case or if the test is dynamically ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.iOS.dll=NUnit.Framework.Api.RunState NotRunnable = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.iOS.dll=NUnit.Framework.Api.RunState Runnable = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The test is runnable. This value would normally not appear on a TestResult, since it would change to Executed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.iOS.dll=NUnit.Framework.Api.RunState Skipped = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The test has been skipped. This value may appear on a Test when certain attributes are used to skip the test.
